text: James L. Brooks (born May 9, 1940) is a three-time Academy Award, nineteen- time Emmy and Golden Globe-winning American producer, writer, and movie director. He is best known for creating American television programs such as The Mary Tyler Moore Show, The Simpsons, Rhoda and Taxi. His best-known movie is Terms of Endearment, for which he received three Academy Awards in 1984. ==References== * * ==Other websites== * * Gracie Films Website Category:1940 births Category:Living people Category:American movie directors Category:American screenwriters Category:American Emmy Award winners Category:Writers from New York City
title: James L. Brooks
